definition: feudal vassal/feudal princes, esp. the monarchs (dukes or princes) of the several vassal states 諸侯國|诸侯国 of Zhou during Western Zhou and Spring and Autumn periods 11th-5th century BC/subordinate warlord/local official
surname Zhu
all/various
marquis, second of the five orders of ancient Chinese nobility 五等爵位[wu3 deng3 jue2 wei4]/nobleman or high official
surname Hou
vassal state
(expr.) hold the feudal overlord and you control his vassals

sentences.english: The following year, the six countries entered into a vassal of the Union combined vertical.
sentences.chinese: 第二年，六国诸侯订立了合纵的联盟。

sentences.english: Before that, China was a confederation of states, called "the middle kingdoms".
sentences.chinese: 统一之前，中国是诸侯国的邦联，叫做“中央王国”。

sentences.english: Small kingdom built huge walls aiming at protecting their territories.
sentences.chinese: 诸侯国修起城墙，借以保护他们的领土。

sentences.english: So the territory of Shang should include these states into it.
sentences.chinese: 商代国家疆域应包括这些诸侯国在内。

sentences.english: When monarch and states vanished, like a sigh.
sentences.chinese: 帝王和诸侯们也都消失，像一声叹惋。

sentences.english: On account of me you will stand before governors and kings as witnesses to them.
sentences.chinese: 又为我的缘故站在诸侯与君王面前，对他们作见证。

sentences.english: Diplomacy had much function in each development process of various states.
sentences.chinese: 邦交在各诸侯国的发展过程中起着非常重要的作用。

sentences.english: Wang will be closed for his vassal to the west of Shaanxi Qishan land grant him.
sentences.chinese: 平王便封他为诸侯，将陕西岐山以西的土地赐予他。

sentences.english: Ducal states at that time built walls to defend their own territories.
sentences.chinese: 当时的各个诸侯国为了保护自己的领地而修建城墙。

sentences.english: Chau conferred great gifts, and the good were enriched.
sentences.chinese: 周朝大封诸侯，使善人都富贵起来。

sentences.english: Ying State was a feudal princedom in Central Plains in the Western Zhou period.
sentences.chinese: 应国是我国西周时期中原地区的一个小诸侯国。

sentences.english: The five ranks of nobility were the legal status of the monarchs under the system of enfeoffment.
sentences.chinese: 五等爵是分封制度下诸侯的法定身份。

sentences.english: Thou act, that is, cut feudatory invasion, sparse human osteosarcoma.
sentences.chinese: 汝用事，即侵削诸侯，疏人骨肉。

sentences.english: History has enabled the five governors called "spring and autumn five bully".
sentences.chinese: 历史上把先后称霸的五个诸侯叫做“春秋五霸”。

sentences.english: Zhou was then the most powerful principality playing the role of hegemonic.
sentences.chinese: 当时，周是所有诸侯的最高权力统领。

sentences.english: Every time Fengdao princes to him for help, he always refused.
sentences.chinese: 每回逢到诸侯向他求救，他总是拒绝。
